data.title: Mardy Fish (United States)
data.meta_description: The American became 'Silver Fish' in 2004 with his performance at the Athens Olympics on the back of tour finals in San Jose and Halle.
data.text:
ByEurosport

Published 29/11/2004 at 01:00 GMT

Mardy Fish reached the gold medal match at the Athens Olympics losing to Nicolas Massu of Chile. The 22-year-old reached tour finals in San Jose and Halle finals and took his form into the Davis Cup competition with wins over Thomas Johansson and Max Mirn

Born: 9 December 1981, Edina, Minnesota

Residence: Tampa, Florida

Turned Pro: 2000

UNITED STATES PROFILES

Patrick McEnroe (United States)

01/12/2004 at 12:57

Plays: Right-handed

Singles ranking: 37

Doubles ranking: 97

Singles Titles: One – 2003 Stockholm

Doubles Titles: Three – 2004 Houston, San Jose; 2002 – Houston

DAVIS CUP Career Record: Played 8 – Won 4, Lost 4

Mardy Fish made his Davis Cup debut for the United States against the Slovak Republic in the 2002 World Group first round. In 2004, the 22-year-old has enjoyed victories over Thomas Johansson of Sweden and Belarusian Max Mirnyi in September's semi-finals.

TOUR SEASON Record: Played 65 – Won 40, Lost 25

Finished the 2004 tour season with a 28-19 singles record, reaching the Athens Olympics gold medal match losing to Nicolas Massu of Chile in five sets. Fish lost to Andy Roddick in the San Jose final and to Roger Federer in Halle.
